subject: Self Care
title: Keystone Habits
description: A short lesson to help you apply Keystone Habits.

hook.text: She started exercising. Then she ate better, slept more, and quit smoking. One habit triggered them all.

buildup.text: Keystone habits create chain reactions. They shift other behaviors without directly targeting them.

discovery.text: Exercise is the most common keystone habit. It improves mood, energy, and discipline across all areas.

twist.text: Negative keystones exist too. Poor sleep can unravel eating, exercise, and emotional regulation together.

climax.text: Don't try to change everything. Find the one habit that pulls others along and start there.

punchline.text: Change one keystone habit. Watch the rest follow.

quiz.question: What is a keystone habit?
options: A habit that triggers positive changes in other behaviors
Any habit lasting over a year
